scm_sal_main.description: Sales and logistics records. Header-level information for all sales-related documents (Sales Invoice, Delivery Order, Sales Order Confirmation, Quotation, etc.). Each row represents a unique sales transaction document.

columns.uniquenum_pri: Primary unique number for internal linking
columns.dnum_reference: Secondary reference number (e.g., Quotation number on SO)
columns.party_unique: Customer unique system ID (preferred for joins)
columns.curr_short_local: Local currency code(Document Currency convert to Local Currency)
columns.wflow_status: Workflow status (e.g., 'app', 'drf', 'rej') Document Status(Approved, Draft, Reject)

relationships.description: Links to line items for this document

business_rules: Always filter by tag_deleted_yn = 'n' for active records.
Use tag_table_usage to filter by document type (e.g., sal_inv for Sales Invoices).
For workflow-approved documents, filter by tag_wflow_app_yn = 'y'.
For customer joins, use party_unique (not party_code) for reliability.
For staff queries: Add AND staff_desc IS NOT NULL AND staff_desc != '' (exclude empty staff names).
For amounts: Include currency ONCE per query (not repeated for each amount field).
When showing sales totals: SELECT staff_desc, SUM(nettot_local) AS total_sales, curr_short_forex AS currency.
For currency questions: SELECT curr_short_forex
For invoice details: SELECT dnum_auto, staff_desc, party_desc, date_post, date_trans, nettot_local, curr_short_forex.
Always add LIMIT for performance.
NEVER repeat the same column multiple times in SELECT.
Group related amount fields logically: nettot_local, amount_local, grosstot_local, subtot_local.
For party/customer queries: Add AND party_desc IS NOT NULL AND party_desc != ''.
Always use date_trans (date of transaction) for any date filters or date range queries; do NOT use date_post (posting date).
Whenever selecting any amount column (such as nett amount, subtotal, total, etc.), always also select curr_short_forex in the result to show the currency code.
Always filter out rows where staff_desc is NULL or blank when reporting by salesperson.
Add to WHERE: AND staff_desc IS NOT NULL AND TRIM(staff_desc) <> ''
Only include named salespeople in any “top salesperson” query.
Do not display results where the salesperson is missing unless specifically requested by the user.

common_queries.sql: SELECT * FROM scm_sal_main WHERE tag_table_usage = 'sal_inv' AND tag_deleted_yn = 'n';

common_queries.purpose: Finding Approved Delivery Orders for a Specific Customer
common_queries.sql: SELECT * FROM scm_sal_main WHERE tag_table_usage = 'stk_do' AND tag_wflow_app_yn = 'y' AND party_unique = ? AND tag_deleted_yn = 'n';

common_queries.purpose: Summarizing Sales Order amounts by Department
common_queries.sql: SELECT deptunit_desc, SUM(amount_local) AS Total_SO_Amount FROM scm_sal_main WHERE tag_table_usage = 'sal_soe' AND tag_deleted_yn = 'n' GROUP BY deptunit_desc;

scm_pur_main.description: Purchase records. Header-level information for all purchase-related documents (PR, PO, PI, GRN, GVN, etc.). Each row represents a unique purchase transaction document.

columns.uniquenum_pri: Primary unique number for internal linking
columns.dnum_reference: Secondary reference number (e.g., PR number on PO)
columns.party_unique: Vendor unique system ID (preferred for joins)
columns.curr_short_local: Local currency code(Document Currency convert to Local Currency)
columns.wflow_status: Workflow status (e.g., 'app', 'drf', 'rej') Document Status(Approved, Draft, Reject)

relationships.description: Links to line items for this document

business_rules: Always filter by tag_deleted_yn = 'n' for active records.
Use tag_table_usage to filter by document type (e.g., pur_po for Purchase Orders).
For workflow-approved documents, filter by tag_wflow_app_yn = 'y'.
For vendor joins, use party_unique (not party_code) for reliability.
Always use date_trans (date of transaction) for any date filters or date range queries; do NOT use date_post (posting date).
Whenever selecting any amount column (such as nett amount, subtotal, total, etc.), always also select curr_short_forex in the result to show the currency code.

common_queries.sql: SELECT * FROM purchase_headers WHERE tag_table_usage = 'pur_po' AND tag_deleted_yn = 'n';

common_queries.purpose: Finding Approved Purchase Invoices for a Specific Vendor
common_queries.sql: SELECT * FROM purchase_headers WHERE tag_table_usage = 'pur_pi' AND tag_wflow_app_yn = 'y' AND party_unique = ? AND tag_deleted_yn = 'n';

common_queries.purpose: Summarizing Purchase Request amounts by Department
common_queries.sql: SELECT deptunit_desc, SUM(amount_local) AS Total_PR_Amount FROM purchase_headers WHERE tag_table_usage = 'pur_pr' AND tag_deleted_yn = 'n' GROUP BY deptunit_desc;

relationships.description: Each sales record is linked to a party (customer)
Each purchase record is linked to a supplier
